summary: Request to add statsd metrics support to TypeScript SDK to track ScheduleToStart and other metrics for production deployments using statsd and Datadog integration.
userImpact: Users cannot easily export SDK metrics like ScheduleToStart to statsd/Datadog without additional infrastructure overhead.
rootCause: TypeScript SDK lacks native statsd exporter support, unlike Java/Go SDKs which use Tally libraries with statsd connectors.
proposedFix: Provide metrics export capabilities from SDK with statsd connector support, potentially through OpenTelemetry collectors or direct statsd export.
workaround: Deploy OpenTelemetry Collector as intermediate service to bridge metrics, though this adds operational complexity.
resolutionDetails: Team decided metrics export through OpenTelemetry Collector is more flexible and sustainable than embedding direct statsd support across all SDKs.
keyQuote: The big problem here is that we emit metrics from both Core and Lang. Every direct export we support it needs to exist in Core and all langs
